sentences: Lugejad võiv ise valida raamatuid riiulilt.
See on hea koht, kus saavad endale sobivaid raamatuid leida.
Raamatukogus paljud lapsed leiuvad oma meelepäraseid raamatuid.
context: The word 'raamatuid' is the partitive plural form of the Estonian noun 'raamat', which means 'book'. The ending '-uid' indicates that this is the partitive case used with plural nouns. In Estonian, the partitive case is often used when talking about indefinite quantities or selections of things. Here it refers to multiple books that can be selected by readers from shelves in a library or bookstore context.
